intro: Psychotria erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red berries that contrast with its dark green foliage. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
